🌄 Streams in the Desert - May 4 🌵

"He makes us sore, and binds us up: he wounds, and his hands make whole"
(Job 5:18) ✝️
🌿 The Ministry of Great Sorrow 🌿

When we walk below mountains that have been shaken by earthquakes and torn apart, we see something beautiful. After destruction comes perfect peace.

💧 Clear pools form beneath fallen rocks, water lilies shine, and reeds whisper in the shadows.

🏡 Villages rebuild over forgotten graves, and white church towers stand tall, showing God's protection - "in whose hand are all the corners of the earth, and the strength of the hills is his also."

- Ruskin

God ploughed one day with an earthquake,
And drove His furrows deep!
The plains jumped up in fear,
The hills began to leap!

But mountains hold a secret,
Hidden in their chest;
"God's peace is everlasting,"
Is their quiet rest.

🌄 He made them homes of beauty,
🌅 Where His grace would stay;
He covers them with morning light,
And sunsets end their day.

🌪️ His winds bring storm messages,
🌊 News from the wild sea;
They sing it through the valleys
💧 In the rain's sweet melody.

🏞️ They nurse the baby rivers,
☁️ Feed His flying clouds;
They shelter newborn races,
Strong, free, and proud.

🏙️ People from tired cities
🙏 Come pray at mountain shrines;
God makes them fresh again
As He passes by all day.

✨ Now I know their secret!
The beauty deep and true!
When hard times come and shake us,
And sorrows break through -

🌾 It's just God ploughing mountains;
And these mountains yet will be
The source of His grace and freshness,
And His everlasting peace for me.

- William C. Gannett
